Information You Provide to Us

We collect your email address when you register so that we can verify that you belong to the organization that you are trying to join on Yolk. The author information of each post gets deleted periodically to minimize the risk of compromised data.
Information We Collect Automatically When You Use the Services
When you access or use our services, we automatically collect information about you, including:
- Log Information: We log information about your use of our services, including the type of browser you use, access times, and pages viewed.
- Device Information: We collect information about the computer you use to access our services, including the hardware model, and operating system and version.

- Information Collected by Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies: We use various technologies to collect information, and this may include sending cookies to your computer. Cookies are small data files stored on your hard drive or in your device memory that helps us to improve our services and your experience, see which areas and features of our services are popular and count visits.

Yolk is an anonymous social network. When you first sign up, you will be assigned the right network based on your email domain. For example, if your email ends in @google.com, you will be assigned to Google network. Yolk needs a culture. Please help all of us make a good one.

Yolk is not a place to deride people. It is rather a place where you can openly share your honest opinions, without having to remain political. Within your network, you can truly become yourself by being anonymous.
